page.title: 18The People of Scotton
page.content: Scotton is a friendly,lively village, where everyone knows almost everyone else,at least by sight.Despite the influx of{newcomers}in the 1960's and 70's there is no feeling of division between the older Scotton families and the newcomers.This is partly because the policy allowing{"infilling"}only has meant that just a few people at a time came into the village.Once here, people tend to stay,often adapting their house or moving to a different one in Scotton as their family needs change.There is a wide range of occupations as well as of ages;class is irrelevant.Village events for{ {church,village hall,playgroup or {Friendship Club}are well supported, though inevitably some give more in time and effort than others.
